curriculum_vitae.introduction: I’ve been working as an Android dev for almost 6  years. I’m a very fast learner and work extremely  well with other team members. I enjoy both learning and passing knowledge on to others. I am an avid fantasy reader, film buff & gamer. I believe I have a few more years to round my skills out as a senior but am always looking for opportunities to capitalise on my soft skills and eventually move to a team lead role.
curriculum_vitae.development: I’m a big fan of everything Android Jetpack. Leveraging these tools allows me to deliver with both speed and confidence. I am most comfortable with modern MVVM/MVI architectures but have worked on projects that use many different approaches. I embrace TDD in all work I do. I enjoy learning from and  mentoring all levels of devs and have spent the last 4 years involved in a mentoring program with Glasgow inner city highschools.

experience.title: Android Developer
experience.description: Worked on a new app for the grocery delivery space.
bullets: Owned the creation of a release test process. Greenfield app  had required several hot fixes in production prior to this, and has required none since.
Worked closely with the localisation team  to implement a standardised process for app localisation.
Worked closely with legal teams and product managers to ensure readiness for google play store release.
Worked with events reporting teams to ensure their additions to the android app played nicely with existing  architecture and design paradigms.

experience.title: Senior Android Developer
experience.description: Maintained and enhanced an authentication library used by all BBC Android apps & later worked on iPlayer & Sounds android apps.
bullets: Transitioned into a new team spread across the UK mid pandemic and was up and running with first code commits within a week
Quickly took on a leadership role as the key android developer within the auth library squad
Worked with apprentices/graduates in a mentoring  role
Owned the bulk of engineering decisions within the authentication library
Gained extensive experience working with legacy code
Identified, actioned and led work to shore up existing security flaws

experience.title: Android Developer
experience.description: Maintained and grew Iberdrola Ireland and Scottish Power consumer apps
bullets: Took the role of  ‘Squad Leader’ for the mobile development team, assisting in story readiness and high level technical solution
Took several features from initial pitch through UX review and API design to implementation and delivery in a fast paced environment
Maintained and built upon 2 live apps with over 250k users
Boosted code coverage of unit testing in both projects
Contributed to production code within a few weeks after upskilling with an unfamiliar bleeding edge tech stack
Interfacing with multiple 3rd party SDK’s
Onboarding and mentoring juniors, mid level and new starts
Documentation of technical solutions (UML  and plain text)
Processing of payments and 3rd party appointment bookings in app

experience.title: Junior Android Developer
bullets: Assisted a small, inexperienced team in releasing their first app to play store
Maintained the first app release and laid the groundwork for a more complex application while learning  RXJava and Kotlin
As a one person team, refactored legacy app to reduce crash rate by 50%

experience.title: Assistant General Manager
experience.description: Ran the famous 'Tav' as it doubled in business
bullets: Running an extremely busy restaurant serving 700 - 1000 meals per day during peak season
Rostered, trained and managed up to 40 FOH staff at a time, keeping wage costs to a minimum
Managed the venue’s live music program for 2 years, during which we won best live music venue in Australia

education.description: Focus on programming, software architecture and agile methodologies. Minor in Economics from University of South Australia. Finished with a HD average.
